Key Match Events: Wales scored early with a goal by Kieffer Moore after 38 seconds.
Harry Wilson scored a long-range goal two minutes later, giving Wales a two-goal lead.
Montenegro's Stefan Jovetic hit the crossbar and had a penalty shout waved off.
Ben Davies cleared a rebound and survived a penalty shout.
Driton Camaj scored Montenegro's only goal in the second half.
Heavy rain affected the match and soaked the players and manager.
Craig Bellamy's aggressive, front-foot approach led to early goals.
Connor Roberts was substituted due to a minor muscle injury.
Montenegro had several chances but couldn't score before halftime.
Wales maintained high pressure and controlled possession early.
Pre-Game Insights: Wales had drawn 1-1 with Turkey in their previous Nations League match.
Wales made five changes to their lineup, including a teenage debutant in the starting XI.
Craig Bellamy emphasized a high-pressing, front-foot style of play.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played in heavy rain, affecting player performance and conditions.
Montenegro's captain Stefan Jovetic was prominent but couldn't capitalize on chances.
Wales' defensive organization and goalkeeper Karl Darlow were crucial in preserving the lead.
